content:
Hello everyone and happy holidays in advance!

I found rust is cool and want to contribute - is there any projects or libraries that need more contributors?

I'm new to open source but have 10+ years experience programming, should be able to speed up quickly. As a beginner I want to find a project that somebody else already have a requirement & design.

Not picky on project and I can learn fast :)

Thank you
Are there any particular areas you're interested in? I know you said you aren't picky, but what's exciting to you? Web, command line, low-level systems stuff, data formats, tools...?

thank you

I found rust is an awesome programming language but my current job doesn't use it. So I want to find an open source project to enjoy rust and improve my skills. I came from backend background so command line, low level systems, tools may fit my experience better.

@isoosiss7 A few possibilities then:

  • The "clap" command-line argument parser could use people helping to finish the move to clap 3.0.
  • The async-std and smol projects are working on reimplementing all of std in an asynchronous way, and could potentially use help. See https://http-rs.zulipchat.com/ for that.
  • If io_uring is at all interesting to you, there are several projects working to integrate it with Rust, such as ringbahn.
  • The gitoxide project is a low-level reimplementation of Git, if that sounds interesting.

@Josh Triplett
Thank you very much, these all sound like very good projects to me, I'll reach out to them.
